text: Baccarat is a town in the Meurthe-et-Moselle area in northeastern France. ==Crystal== In 1764, King Louis the fifteenth allowed to the Bishop of Metz to start a glass factory at Baccarat. The Baccarat crystalworks are famous for their glass and crystal artwork, and the Musée du Cristal, owned by the company, is Lorraine's biggest private museum. ==Sights== The Church of Saint Rémy is well known for its artistic glass windows. ==Related pages== *Communes of the Meurthe-et-Moselle department ==Other websites== * http://www.ville- baccarat.fr Category:Communes in Meurthe-et-Moselle
title: Baccarat, Meurthe-et-Moselle
